title: Priyanka Chopra stuns in midnight blue printed mini dress and white boots as she promotes new movie
text:
She's been travelling across India promoting her new film, love story The Sky Is Pink.

And Priyanka Chopra turned up the glamour once again as she attended the Bollywood movie's final premiere in Mumbai, India, on Sunday.

The actress, 37, stunned in a midnight blue mini dress featuring a funky floral embellishment as she hit the red carpet alongside her co-star Farhan Akhtar.

Glamorous: Priyanka Chopra stunned in a midnight blue printed mini dress as the attended the premiere of her new Bollywood movie, The Sky Is Pink, in Mumbai, India, on Sunday

The screen star spiced up her look with a pair of white leather knee-high boots

Priyanka wore her raven tresses pulled back into a bun and accentuated her striking features with a slick of magenta lipstick.

The actress completed her red carpet look with a pair of delicate silver hoop earrings.

Priyanka shared the moment with co-star Farhan Akhtar, 45, who, dressed down in a Pink Floyd T-shirt, jeans and white trainers.

Rocking the red carpet: The actress, 37, spiced up her look with a pair of white leather knee-high boots

The pair clearly enjoyed each other's company as they laughed together, with Priyanka giggling as Farhan posed alongside her.

Her latest appearance comes after a series of recent promotional events for her new film, which is set to be released in the U.S. on October 11.

The Sky is Pink follows the the span of a 25-year love story as told by the couple's terminally ill teenage daughter.

Priyanka stars as Aditi, a mother who is forced to grapple with her newborn's immune deficiency.

Elegant: Priyanka wore her raven tresses pulled back into a bun and accentuated her striking features with a slick of magenta lipstick while posing with co-star Farhan Akhtar, 45

The actress opened up to Entertainment Weekly about a moment in the movie that made her husband, musician Nick Jonas, 27, tear up.

'I was filming The Sky Is Pink till four days before my wedding and Nick was on set,' she told the outlet.

'We were doing prep for the wedding on set and my co-producers and Shonali, they were so accommodating.'

The couple wed in two ceremonies, with number one located in Jodhpur, India in December 2018.

She told the Times of India that viewers should bring both their 'brain and heart' when watching the movie.

Plenty to smile about: The pair clearly enjoyed each other's company as they laughed together, with Priyanka giggling as Farhan posed alongside her

'This is a very special film based on a special real-life couple who thrive through extraordinary circumstances,' she began.

'I feel like in a cynical world today where we live our own lives, this film shows you what it can do when you have a family, family support.'

She continued: 'I feel like when I read the movie (script), that's when you know.. jumped out at me so much because my parents were like that.

'They were extremely supportive and that gave me the ability to be who I am and where I am today. You will need your brain and your heart.'
